sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The length function returns the number of characters in the string. The string must be initialized. For example, length("table") is 5.
sections.text_content: The length function returns the number of characters in the string. The string must be initialized. For example, length("table") is 5.
sections.mdown_content: The **length** function returns the number of characters in the string. The string must be initialized. For example, **length**("table") is 5.

sections.title: Example
code:
var word : string
        for i : 1 .. 3
            get word
            put length ( word )
        end for
sections.raw_content:
This program inputs three words and outputs their lengths.

If the words are "cat", "robin" and "crow", the program will output 3, 5 and 4.
sections.text_content:
This program inputs three words and outputs their lengths.

If the words are "cat", "robin" and "crow", the program will output 3, 5 and 4.
sections.mdown_content:
This program inputs three words and outputs their lengths.
If the words are "cat", "robin" and "crow", the program will output 3, 5 and 4.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The length function gives the current length of the string. To find the maximum length of a string, use upper. For example, given the declaration var s : string (10), upper (s) returns 10.
sections.text_content: The length function gives the current length of the string. To find the maximum length of a string, use upper. For example, given the declaration var s : string (10), upper (s) returns 10.
sections.mdown_content: The **length** function gives the current length of the string. To find the maximum length of a string, use **upper**. For example, given the declaration **var** s : **string** (10), **upper** (*s*) returns 10.
